properties.areaDesc: Northeastern Mendocino Interior; Northwestern Mendocino Interior
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 2:16PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Eureka CA
properties.description:
...LIGHT SNOW EXPECTED MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING...
...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM LIKELY LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH
THURSDAY...

.Snow levels have risen slightly during the day Monday, but will
drop to near 2500 feet overnight tonight. As a result, several
local highway summits will see additional light snow
accumulations from late this evening through Tuesday morning.

A more significant winter storm is expected to impact the region
late Wednesday afternoon through Thursday, with widespread heavy
mountain snow accumulations likely. Snow levels are expected to
fall from 3000 to nearly 2000 feet Wednesday night, which will
bring heavy snow accumulations to numerous interior mountain
highways, including Highways 299, 36, 3, and potentially 199, in
addition to numerous rural roadways. In addition, accumulating
small hail will be possible in coastal low elevations late
Wednesday night and Thursday. Travel will likely become dangerous
or even temporarily impossible in some high elevation areas, so
please prepare now.

* WHAT...Heavy snow likely above 2500 feet. 3 to 6 inches between
2500 and 3500 feet, with totals near one foot possible above
3500 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Northwestern Mendocino Interior and Northeastern
Mendocino Interior Counties.

* WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening
commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state of California can be
obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2500 FEET
